data.title: Just awesome!
data.text:
I frequent this spa, the masseuses are wonderful. My husband regularly gets me gift cards. They have a 'water' room with a spa, steam room and dry sauna. They also do manicures and pedicures that last.
Last time there i had the 'Glow' package, a  one hour sugar scrub followed a one hour massage. It was very nice.

data.title: Love those facials !
data.text: The best facial I've ever had.  My skin glowed all day long.  Love the calming atmosphere of Oasis and great location on Ralston Road.

data.title: Gift Certificates Buyer Beware
data.text:
My stepson bought six gift certificates (order #201643) for $720. They were for the women in our family so they can go to the Oasis spa for Mother’s day and receive services, particularly a social group manicure/pedicure, and spa packages they had there in the past. But, when the women tried to set up their appointments they found things have materially and substantially changed. For example, due to staffing shortages only two staff that can do nails at a time. 

After my stepdaughter called twice, and I called four times (5/23/2016, 5/24, 5/25 and 5/26), Brenda the owner did get in touch with me. The result is Oasis is unable to give services that women in our family have received in the past. They are also unwilling to give a refund of any kind. She stated a no refund policy on the website that I imagine is there, but was unable to find after scrutiny. I do now see a link to a refund policy on the actual gift certificates (after purchase).

Brenda also said (to paraphrase) it was either too complicated or the mechanics did not exist to give a refund so we can go somewhere else. I’m not sure I followed the line of reasoning here, but that was my attempt to communicate it. 

When I said I would be forced to contact the BBB, Yelp, and consider small claims court, she said this was OK, the no refund policy was clear on the website and her attorneys had thoroughly reviewed it.

data.title: Great mani/pedi service!
data.text: I would say don't miss the great care and service at Oasis. Very relaxing, and the best of care! Lisa and Azariah are wonderful!

data.title: A Hidden Gem
data.text:
For a local day spa, this is a wonderful place to unwind.  I should know ... I've been a customer for over 10 years!  Full service - from facials, massages, and pedicures to boutique-quality beauty products and scented candles for sale in the check-in area.

On the first level, you'll receive salon services plus there are spacious locker/changing rooms with showers for men and women.  On the upper level (wheelchair accessible via elevator), you'll find the "water room" - hot tub, steam, sauna, and a shower - and treatment rooms.  Everything is well-appointed with plenty of quiet spaces, thick towels, and a refreshment bar where you'll find water and tea.  Love the "oasis" wall art!

By the way, swimwear is required as the "water room" is co-ed.  Bonus:  plastic bags for wet swimwear are in the locker room.
